content: So, yeah, I FINALLY got to go fishing/camping, and what a weekend it was! Pictures speak for themselves, but I’ll caption each one to explain them (all captions above the corresponding picture). I’d appreciate it if you’d read the captions – hey, I’m taking the time to type ‘em out, eh? LOL! It was a GREAT weekend, and we caught a mess of fish (and a few turtles). We used worms and shrimp, but the cats were nailing the worms more than the shrimp. Then we cast net for minnows and locked into the bass, with me catching three of them all between 2 and 3 pounds. These are small ponds in the middle of Arlington, TX, where they are building a huge subdivision of houses. For now, they are still open for public fishing. Many beers died in the making of this pictorial. I thought my buddy John would, too, but he lived, lol. First pond we went to – no luck there. That’s my buddy John John’s dog, Sophie (the mutt) Scenery of pond #1 After no luck there, we hit this here pond It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

Many beers died in the making of this pictorial. I thought my buddy John would, too, but he lived, lol. First pond we went to – no luck there. That’s my buddy John John’s dog, Sophie (the mutt) Scenery of pond #1 After no luck there, we hit this here pond It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
reply: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? title: Finally fishing!  Lots of pics!  56k don't even think of it!

content: quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Man, trash is one of those things that really pizzes me off! I never go out with a buttload of extra trash bags to pick up from the other slobs (and there was a LOT of trash right there). Damn kids. We threw the turtles back, as we did the biggest and smallest fish. Leave the biggest to breed and the smallest to grow up for next trip. All the Carp went back, too, obviously. We caught about 50 all total, not including John's Carp that he accidentally netted cast netting for minnows, lol. We kept 3 Bass, 1 Crappie, and about 8 Channel cats. Everything else was released without injury. And Gar are freshwater fish, but because of their needle teeth they are rarely caught. Guys that actually fish FOR them (they are GREAT fighters!) usually use a minnow-type spinnerbait that they wrap in crochet yarn to snag around their teeth; their mouths are solid bone, so hooks won't catch them, which is why I was so surprised to snag the one I did. I had a hangover for two days, LOL. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles?
reply: Man, trash is one of those things that really pizzes me off! I never go out with a buttload of extra trash bags to pick up from the other slobs (and there was a LOT of trash right there). Damn kids. We threw the turtles back, as we did the biggest and smallest fish. Leave the biggest to breed and the smallest to grow up for next trip. All the Carp went back, too, obviously. We caught about 50 all total, not including John's Carp that he accidentally netted cast netting for minnows, lol. We kept 3 Bass, 1 Crappie, and about 8 Channel cats. Everything else was released without injury. And Gar are freshwater fish, but because of their needle teeth they are rarely caught. Guys that actually fish FOR them (they are GREAT fighters!) usually use a minnow-type spinnerbait that they wrap in crochet yarn to snag around their teeth; their mouths are solid bone, so hooks won't catch them, which is why I was so surprised to snag the one I did. I had a hangover for two days, LOL. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: Ummmmmm.....Crappie, good eatin'! I finally got out on the Chesapeake a couple of weeks ago for Rockfish (Striped Bass). Caught a 38" 25 pounder and it is in the freezer (or what is left of it). Darn thing beat the crap outta me! Good day. All fish landed were above 28" minimum and ranged from 33" to 40" and 19 to 28 pounds. Ah, yes; that time of year I will hold a service for the dead beer tomorrow night

content: quote: Here is a couple of 'buts' caught last year when we vistited some friends in Homer,Ak. (My wife caught these , I got skunked) Ahhh- "Chicken-buts"!! The smaller ones are great for fillets!! We used to catch 'em (or buy'em) when I was on Adak Island. The bigger ones were always carved for steaks and roasts, with the bit's and pieces used fofr beer-batter fry..... I always got the cheeks, too! Best part of the fish!!!
quote: Here is a couple of 'buts' caught last year when we vistited some friends in Homer,Ak. (My wife caught these , I got skunked)

content: quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Man, trash is one of those things that really pizzes me off! I never go out with a buttload of extra trash bags to pick up from the other slobs (and there was a LOT of trash right there). Damn kids. We threw the turtles back, as we did the biggest and smallest fish. Leave the biggest to breed and the smallest to grow up for next trip. All the Carp went back, too, obviously. We caught about 50 all total, not including John's Carp that he accidentally netted cast netting for minnows, lol. We kept 3 Bass, 1 Crappie, and about 8 Channel cats. Everything else was released without injury. And Gar are freshwater fish, but because of their needle teeth they are rarely caught. Guys that actually fish FOR them (they are GREAT fighters!) usually use a minnow-type spinnerbait that they wrap in crochet yarn to snag around their teeth; their mouths are solid bone, so hooks won't catch them, which is why I was so surprised to snag the one I did. I had a hangover for two days, LOL. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: Ummmmmm.....Crappie, good eatin'! I finally got out on the Chesapeake a couple of weeks ago for Rockfish (Striped Bass). Caught a 38" 25 pounder and it is in the freezer (or what is left of it). Darn thing beat the crap outta me! Good day. All fish landed were above 28" minimum and ranged from 33" to 40" and 19 to 28 pounds. Ah, yes; that time of year I will hold a service for the dead beer tomorrow night

content: So, yeah, I FINALLY got to go fishing/camping, and what a weekend it was! Pictures speak for themselves, but I’ll caption each one to explain them (all captions above the corresponding picture). I’d appreciate it if you’d read the captions – hey, I’m taking the time to type ‘em out, eh? LOL! It was a GREAT weekend, and we caught a mess of fish (and a few turtles). We used worms and shrimp, but the cats were nailing the worms more than the shrimp. Then we cast net for minnows and locked into the bass, with me catching three of them all between 2 and 3 pounds. These are small ponds in the middle of Arlington, TX, where they are building a huge subdivision of houses. For now, they are still open for public fishing. Many beers died in the making of this pictorial. I thought my buddy John would, too, but he lived, lol. First pond we went to – no luck there. That’s my buddy John John’s dog, Sophie (the mutt) Scenery of pond #1 After no luck there, we hit this here pond It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
reply: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles? Man, trash is one of those things that really pizzes me off! I never go out with a buttload of extra trash bags to pick up from the other slobs (and there was a LOT of trash right there). Damn kids. We threw the turtles back, as we did the biggest and smallest fish. Leave the biggest to breed and the smallest to grow up for next trip. All the Carp went back, too, obviously. We caught about 50 all total, not including John's Carp that he accidentally netted cast netting for minnows, lol. We kept 3 Bass, 1 Crappie, and about 8 Channel cats. Everything else was released without injury. And Gar are freshwater fish, but because of their needle teeth they are rarely caught. Guys that actually fish FOR them (they are GREAT fighters!) usually use a minnow-type spinnerbait that they wrap in crochet yarn to snag around their teeth; their mouths are solid bone, so hooks won't catch them, which is why I was so surprised to snag the one I did. I had a hangover for two days, LOL. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: LOL hahaha, Looks like you had a real good time. I really appreciated that you cleaned up after the jerks that preceded you. Reminds me of an artist Bob Dozono. He was Army, stationed in Germany during his entire enlistment. Here in Oregon Bob would go fishing, pick up all the trash, take the trash home and sanitize it, put the trash on a sized canvas, size the trash, paint nature over the trash using the trash for a 3 dimensional texture. I admired him and felt that if more fishermen put this kind of care into their favorite fishing holes, we would all be a lot better off. That "GAR" ??? looked nasty. I thought they were a saltwater fish though? I guess you learn something every day. What was the total of fish caught? What did you do with those turtles?
reply: Man, trash is one of those things that really pizzes me off! I never go out with a buttload of extra trash bags to pick up from the other slobs (and there was a LOT of trash right there). Damn kids. We threw the turtles back, as we did the biggest and smallest fish. Leave the biggest to breed and the smallest to grow up for next trip. All the Carp went back, too, obviously. We caught about 50 all total, not including John's Carp that he accidentally netted cast netting for minnows, lol. We kept 3 Bass, 1 Crappie, and about 8 Channel cats. Everything else was released without injury. And Gar are freshwater fish, but because of their needle teeth they are rarely caught. Guys that actually fish FOR them (they are GREAT fighters!) usually use a minnow-type spinnerbait that they wrap in crochet yarn to snag around their teeth; their mouths are solid bone, so hooks won't catch them, which is why I was so surprised to snag the one I did. I had a hangover for two days, LOL. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
